Description: Part of a clay jar-seal: with the impression of a repeated design, showing a bird and the r-sign hieroglyph. The seal is fairly well preserved, the inscribed surface being slightly worn.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl. XIII, 96; H. R. Hall, 'Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs etc. in the British Museum: Volume 1 : Royal scarabs' (London, 1913), 286, no. 2749; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit III, (Wiesbaden, 1964), pl. 7, abb. 13.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1913 / Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs, etc. in the British Museum (2749)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2003, Apr-Oct, Graz, Eggenberg Palace, 'The Tower of Babel'
